name: Pep Guardiola
style: Positional play, high possession, structured pressing.
kid_friendly_summary: Pep wants his team to control the game like chess, always moving into clever spaces and keeping the ball.

name: Jürgen Klopp
style: High pressing, quick transitions, vertical attacking.
kid_friendly_summary: Klopp’s teams run like crazy, win the ball back fast, and attack the goal at full speed.

name: Carlo Ancelotti
style: Calm, adaptable, uses players in their favourite roles.
kid_friendly_summary: Ancelotti is like a calm football uncle who lets stars do what they’re best at while keeping the team balanced.

name: Franz Beckenbauer
style: Elegant build-up from the back, sweeper tradition.
kid_friendly_summary: Beckenbauer helped invent the idea of a defender who doesn’t just clear the ball, but starts attacks too.

name: Didier Deschamps
style: Solid defence, powerful counterattacks, strong team spirit.
kid_friendly_summary: Deschamps builds teams that are hard to break down and lightning fast when they attack.
